question: [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-table-info/src/backup_restore/gcs.rs] [Function: new()] [Authentication bypass] Can an attacker exploit the expect() panic on authentication failure to crash the indexer service by manipulating GCS authentication credentials, causing denial of service for the entire table info indexing system? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-table-info/src/backup_restore/gcs.rs] [Function: new()] [Privilege escalation] Does the with_auth() method properly validate service account permissions, or can an attacker use a compromised service account with excessive GCS permissions to read/write arbitrary buckets and corrupt backup data across multiple chains? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-table-info/src/backup_restore/gcs.rs] [Function: new()] [Configuration injection] Can an attacker manipulate environment variables or configuration files to inject malicious GCS credentials during ClientConfig creation, allowing unauthorized access to backup buckets containing sensitive indexer state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-table-info/src/backup_restore/gcs.rs] [Function: new()] [Resource exhaustion] Is there a limit on concurrent GcsBackupRestoreOperator instances, or can an attacker create unlimited operators to exhaust GCS API quotas and prevent legitimate backup/restore operations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-table-info/src/backup_restore/gcs.rs] [Function: verify_storage_bucket_existence()] [Panic-based DoS] Can an attacker cause the unwrap_or_else panic by deleting or restricting access to the GCS bucket after initialization but before verification, causing catastrophic service failure during indexer startup? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-table-info/src/backup_restore/gcs.rs] [Function: verify_storage_bucket_existence()] [TOCTOU race condition] Does the bucket existence check at startup prevent bucket deletion/modification during runtime, or can an attacker delete the bucket immediately after verification passes, causing subsequent backup operations to fail silently or corrupt state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-table-info/src/backup_restore/gcs.rs] [Function: verify_storage_bucket_existence()] [Bucket substitution] Can an attacker exploit a race condition between bucket verification and actual backup operations to substitute a malicious bucket with the same name, causing backups to be written to an attacker-controlled storage location? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-table-info/src/backup_restore/gcs.rs] [Function: verify_storage_bucket_existence()] [Cross-tenant confusion] If multiple chains use similar bucket naming patterns, can an attacker trick the system into verifying the wrong bucket by exploiting namespace collisions in GCS bucket names? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-table-info/src/backup_restore/gcs.rs] [Function: get_metadata()] [Panic on error] Can an attacker cause the panic in error handling by triggering non-404 HTTP errors (e.g., 403 Forbidden, 429 Rate Limit) during metadata download, crashing the indexer service and causing loss of liveness? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-table-info/src/backup_restore/gcs.rs] [Function: get_metadata()] [Error handling bypass] Does the function properly distinguish between legitimate missing metadata and GCS API failures, or can an attacker exploit error handling to force the system into an inconsistent state by triggering specific HTTP status codes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-table-info/src/backup_restore/gcs.rs] [Function: get_metadata()] [Metadata tampering] Can an attacker with GCS write access replace the metadata.json file with malicious content to manipulate chain_id or epoch values, causing the indexer to restore corrupted snapshots or skip critical data? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-table-info/src/backup_restore/gcs.rs] [Function: get_metadata()] [Deserialization vulnerability] Can an attacker craft a malicious metadata JSON file that exploits serde_json deserialization to cause panics, memory corruption, or arbitrary code execution when BackupRestoreMetadata::from() is called? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-table-info/src/backup_restore/gcs.rs] [Function: download_metadata_object()] [Man-in-the-middle] Does the download_object operation verify TLS certificates and integrity, or can an attacker perform MITM attacks to inject malicious metadata during download, causing chain_id confusion or epoch rollback attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-table-info/src/backup_restore/gcs.rs] [Function: download_metadata_object()] [Incomplete download] Can network interruptions or malicious GCS responses cause partial metadata downloads that result in corrupted BackupRestoreMetadata objects with uninitialized fields leading to undefined behavior? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-table-info/src/backup_restore/gcs.rs] [Function: download_metadata_object()] [Size limit bypass] Is there a maximum size limit for metadata downloads, or can an attacker upload an extremely large metadata.json file to cause memory exhaustion during the download operation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-table-info/src/backup_restore/gcs.rs] [Function: create_default_metadata_if_absent()] [Chain ID validation bypass] Can an attacker exploit the chain_id assertion to cause a panic by providing mismatched chain_id values, or worse, can they bypass the validation to initialize metadata for the wrong chain causing cross-chain state corruption? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-table-info/src/backup_restore/gcs.rs] [Function: create_default_metadata_if_absent()] [Race condition on initialization] If multiple indexer instances start simultaneously, can they both detect missing metadata and create conflicting default metadata files, leading to epoch inconsistencies or lost backup data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-table-info/src/backup_restore/gcs.rs] [Function: create_default_metadata_if_absent()] [Epoch initialization vulnerability] Does initializing metadata with epoch 0 create a security window where an attacker can restore an old epoch 0 snapshot over newer data, effectively performing a rollback attack on the indexer state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-table-info/src/backup_restore/gcs.rs] [Function: create_default_metadata_if_absent()] [Error state inconsistency] If update_metadata() succeeds but the function returns an error, can this create a state where metadata exists in GCS but the local system believes it failed, leading to repeated initialization attempts and data inconsistency? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-table-info/src/backup_restore/gcs.rs] [Function: create_default_metadata_if_absent()] [Panic vs error handling] Can an attacker exploit the expect() panic on update_metadata failure to crash the indexer during initialization, preventing the service from ever starting successfully? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-table-info/src/backup_restore/gcs.rs] [Function: update_metadata()] [Infinite retry loop] Can an attacker trigger continuous 429 rate limit errors to trap update_metadata() in an infinite retry loop, preventing epoch progression and causing the indexer to fall behind the chain indefinitely? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-table-info/src/backup_restore/gcs.rs] [Function: update_metadata()] [Retry logic abuse] Can an attacker manipulate GCS responses to repeatedly trigger 500ms sleeps in the retry logic, causing metadata updates to take extremely long and blocking critical backup operations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-table-info/src/backup_restore/gcs.rs] [Function: update_metadata()] [Rate limit weaponization] Does the retry logic on 429 errors properly handle GCS's 'one write per second' quota, or can an attacker trigger rapid metadata updates from multiple sources to create a permanent rate limit condition preventing any metadata updates? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-table-info/src/backup_restore/gcs.rs] [Function: update_metadata()] [Serialization failure] Can an attacker craft chain_id or epoch values that cause serde_json::to_vec() to fail or produce invalid JSON, leading to unwrap() panic and service crash during metadata update? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-table-info/src/backup_restore/gcs.rs] [Function: update_metadata()] [Concurrent metadata corruption] If multiple backup operations call update_metadata() concurrently with different epoch values, can race conditions cause metadata to be overwritten with older epochs, leading to snapshot inconsistency? (Critical)
